newsitem.title: FRANCE: Paris welcomes Gabon mediation offer for Congo.
newsitem.headline: Paris welcomes Gabon mediation offer for Congo.

text.p: France on Saturday welcomed a mediation offer by Gabonese President Omar Bongo in a bid to end a flareup in fighting in Congo Brazzaville, but warned French citizens in the Congo capital to stay at home.

"France supports the mediation offer of President Bongo, whom we congratulate," Foreign Ministry spokesman Yves Doutriaux said. "This appeal could enable the normal democratic electoral process to go forward."
Paris on Friday urged all sides in the fighting to renounce violence so a presidential election scheduled for July 27 could go ahead.
Relative calm reigned in Brazzaville on Saturday after two days of fighting between supporters of former president Denis Sassou Nguesso and the army, witnesses said.
